Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Hello there

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Saw questions about Barterlly, the best you can do is to just join the dedicated discord

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
no KMD officials are behind the project, just me. The Komodo mention on the bottom of the page mentions Komodo Community, not official team ;)
About the current tech used, **NO** it doesn't use atomic swapping. You will be able to find the reasons, and foresee the roadmap via medium links, won't explain everything here, but to sum up, Today, we got a classic infrastructure, and our goal is to get rid of it using atomicswaps if / when possible, and mix that with any other cool tech that will allow more and more coins to be added : 
https://medium.com/@dwy_15555/barterlly-from-an-idea-to-a-journey-e882fc12b0a6
https://medium.com/@dwy_15555/barterlly-the-journey-begins-6fa1c6913c5e
https://discord.gg/4chW5Qr

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: As am basically handling all requests and support (the Beta is launched and live), pretty hard to followup on all chans ^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <CryptoBlastoff> Is dPoW a shared cost spread equally across all participating networks? In other words, when a new project comes aboard, does that drive down costs for everyone?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <freerider101> each dpow for a chain cost 300kmd/year (re @CryptoBlastoff: Is dPoW a shared cost spread equally across all participating networks? In other words, when a new project comes aboard, does that drive down costs for everyone?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Acura360> That’s the old price ...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> The current price is roughly $2500 USD + 365KMD per year + Security Review for external chains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> The kmd team created a ladder pricing which increases every time a new project is added. We just added Koinon to dpow which means the next project pays a slightly higher price until 100 projects are reached at which point the price will be $10000/y

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> The sooner you get added the better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <kremer (n k)> Does the cost in KMD appreciate? Or only cost in USD has appreciation?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <kremer (n k)> In other words, it's 365 kmd right now. Does that increase as more chains onboard like you're saying occurs with USD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <CryptoBlastoff> Thx 👍 (re @PTYX11: The kmd team created a ladder pricing which increases every time a new project is added. We just added Koinon to dpow which means the next project pays a slightly higher price until 100 projects are reached at which point the price will be $10000/y)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> The KMD portion remains at 365,  the reason that number was chosen was to attach the quality of a “unit of account” to the currency.  1 KMD = direct cost of notarization for one chain for one day

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <pattersonbrad> What's this voting thing about kmd and where can I vote?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> KMD holders get 1 Vote for every 1 KMD they have. The vote is to select the next round of Notary Nodes.
https://komodoelection.com/ (re @pattersonbrad: What's this voting thing about kmd and where can I vote?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> You have to have had the KMD in a wallet that supports the Vote airdrop, or at least have your keys.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Like Agama or Magnum wallets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <pattersonbrad> Oh I see will check this out first, I thought it's a voting for listing in an exchange. (re @Regnar: KMD holders get 1 Vote for every 1 KMD they have. The vote is to select the next round of Notary Nodes.
https://komodoelection.com/)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <chachiy> if none? I can't vote? (re @Regnar: KMD holders get 1 Vote for every 1 KMD they have. The vote is to select the next round of Notary Nodes.
https://komodoelection.com/)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <pattersonbrad> For sure since they have a requirement for it, just check out the link provided for you to know. (re @chachiy: if none? I can't vote?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> No KMD no vote. It's a way for KMD holders to select the Notaries for the ecosystem. Notaries post what they plan to do to help the ecosystem, things like using NN mining rewards to fund community projects, contests, or create products and content (re @chachiy: if none? I can't vote?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Usually NNs are community members who have been working and building in Komodo ecosystem and build up reputation and respect. The elections are a good way to help the ecosystem grow, which is why you see NNs dedicating mining rewards to fund new startups like Komodore64 and Barterlly, as well as established businesses running for NN to fund their projects (which also help the ecosystem)
